name: Beef and Beer Fondue
author: dolphinut
summary: I got this recipe from my mother. We always have it at parties. The fondue is a thick, rich, tomato-type fondue. There is no cheese in it and it doesn't need it. The meatballs soak up some of the sauce to make it super yummy! It's always a hit for us, so I thought I'd share.
ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer
directions: Mix ketchup, beer, Worcestershire sauce, and bay leaves together in a slow cooker (such as Crock-Pot®) set over High
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and cook meatballs, turning as needed, until browned, about 7 minutes
Place meatballs in the slow cooker
Cook on High until sauce is thick, about 5 hours
